cloud.name: Perfect Storage
cloud.desc: The intern is exploring S3 buckets to host internal documents. He insists that he has scoped the IAM policy correctly to restrict access solely to the admin. Prove the intern wrong by escalating your user privileges and access the secret document!

cloud.name: pawtainer hub
cloud.desc: The new intern is testing out a few services, help to audit it to ensure there are no misconfiguration.

crypto.name: Baby LCG
crypto.desc:
I just started learning about LCG!

Unfortunately, it seems that LCG is quite weak, given how there are so many papers showing how easily you can crack LCG parameters.

Maybe you can crack my LCG setup too?

crypto.name: LMentary
crypto.desc:
The organisers of the FlagIsland contest recently commisioned a new employee portal. There's probably more information on the portal about the shadowy event, if only we could find a way to log in.

One of our undercover agents managed to exfiltrate some files from their developers - could this website be their weakest link?

forensic.name: Baby PCAP
forensic.desc: I want to be like the cool kids, so I got chatGPT to write me a custom DNS C2 framework!

forensic.name: More RAM Part 1
forensic.desc:
Little John thought he could download galvanised steel squares from the internet :O

Download: https://drive.google.com/file/d/14SrUWo9JF9oOa8glfRfzfk8ZUw7g-yBU/view?usp=sharing

forensic.name: More RAM Part 2
forensic.desc:
Little John turned his 0GB RAM Laptop into 10GB RAM using several galvanized steel squares and some other stuff...

Download: https://drive.google.com/file/d/14SrUWo9JF9oOa8glfRfzfk8ZUw7g-yBU/view?usp=sharing

misc.name: Log Analysis
misc.desc: Strange traffics were observed at endpoint "supersecure". Just what is going on in the network?

misc.name: Matryoshka
misc.desc: Someone told me about the infinite money glitch. I wonder, does that work for compression as well?

osint.name: Pool Party

pwn.name: file storage
pwn.desc: Is this what they call containerization?

pwn.name: pprotocol
pwn.desc: This server implements a strange protocol for message encoding. Can you figure it out? (The server implements a 2-part protocol for receiving messages. If the message is too long, it is split into 2 parts. If the message is short enough, it is sent in one go.)

rev.name: Secret
rev.desc: Can you crack the code to the candy machine and claim your sweet prize?

web.name: AsciiDoc Parser
web.desc: Everyone knows markdown, but what about asciidoc. Try write some asciidoc! Author: ocean

web.name: Await Flag
web.desc: Welcome to the Future where we have "Multi" factor authentication in parallel! Author: ocean
